Talent.Name: Anatomy Lessons
Talent.Description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Intellect to one hit.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Grenadier
Talent.Description: Decrease the [ADVANTAGE] cost to activate the Blast quality on any weapon used by 1 to a minimum of 1.

Talent.Name: Burly
Talent.Description: Reduce any wielded weapon’s Cumbersome quality and Encumbrance rating by ranks in Burly to a minimum of 1.

Talent.Name: Heavy Hitter
Talent.Description: Once per session, spend [TRIUMPH] on a successful Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery check to add the Breach 1 quality to the attack, or increase an existing Breach rating by 1.

Talent.Name: Heroic Resilience
Talent.Description: Immediately after being hit by an attack but before suffering damage, spend 1 Destiny Point to increase soak by ranks in Resilience

Talent.Name: Improvised Detonation
Talent.Description: The character may make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] to construct a secure position. This provides cover for the group and its vehicles.

Talent.Name: Improvised Detonation (Improved)
Talent.Description: Reduce the difficulty of Improvised Detonation’s check to [DI][DI] and increase damage to twice ranks in Mechanics.

Talent.Name: Loom
Talent.Description: When an ally engaged with the character makes a successful Charm, Deception, or Negotiation check, the character adds [ADVANTAGE] per rank in Coercion to the ally’s check.

Talent.Name: Rain of Death
Talent.Description: Perform the Rain of Death maneuver to ignore the increased difficulty due to Auto-fire attacks made this turn.

Talent.Name: Steady Nerves
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Steady Nerves from Cool or Skulduggery checks.

Talent.Name: Talk the Talk
Talent.Description: When making a Knowledge check, the character may spend 1 Destiny Point to substitute Knowledge (Underworld) or Streetwise for the required skill.

Talent.Name: Walk the Walk
Talent.Description: The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to his ranks in Streetwise to one hit of a successful Brawl check.

Talent.Name: True Aim
Talent.Description: Once per round, may perform a True Aim maneuver to gain benefits of aiming and upgrade combat check once per rank of True Aim.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Uncanny Reactions
Talent.Description: Add [BOOST] per rank of Uncanny Reactions to all Vigilance checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Uncanny Senses
Talent.Description: Add [BOOST] per rank of Uncanny Senses to all Perception checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Utility Belt
Talent.Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Utility Belt incidental; produce a previously undocumented item or weapon (with restrictions) from a tool belt or a satchel.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Utinni!
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Utinni! from checks to find or scavenge items or gear. Such checks take half the time.
Talent.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Well Rounded
Talent.Description: Choose any 2 skills. They permanently become career skills.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Wheel and Deal
Talent.Description: When selling goods legally, gain 10% more credits per rank of Wheel and Deal.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Clever Solution
Talent.Description: Once per session, make one skill check using Cunning rather than the characteristic linked to that skill.

Talent.Name: Full Throttle (Improved)
Talent.Description: Take a Full Throttle action; make a [DI][DI][DI] Piloting check to increase a vehicle’s top speed by 1 for a number of rounds equal to Cunning.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Full Throttle (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When performing Full Throttle, top speed increases by 2 instead of 1.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Shortcut
Talent.Description: During a chase, add [BOOST] per rank in Shortcut to any checks made to catch or escape an opponent.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Unrelenting Skeptic
Talent.Description: When targeted by a Deception check, the character automatically adds [FAILURE] to the check equal to ranks in Vigilance.

Talent.Name: Shortcut (Improved)
Talent.Description: When engaging in a chase or race, suffer 2 strain to add [SUCCESS] equal to ranks in Shortcut to the check.

Talent.Name: Full Stop
Talent.Description: When piloting a ship or vehicle, take a Full Stop maneuver to reduce speed to zero. Suffer system strain equal to the speed reduced.

Talent.Name: Pin
Talent.Description: Take Pin action: make an Opposed Athletics check to immobilize an engaged opponent until the end of the character’s next turn. Spend [TRIUMPH] to extend duration one round.

Talent.Name: Museum Worthy
Talent.Description: Once per session, take Museum Worthy action, make [DI][DI][DI] Knowledge (Educaiton) check to gain information regarding a relic, ruin, or piece of history.

Talent.Name: Bring It Down
Talent.Description: Once per attack, spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage to a single hit equal to target’s Brawn value.

Talent.Name: Hunter's Quarry
Talent.Description: Take Hunter’s Quarry action; make a [DI][DI][DI] Survival check to upgrade the ability of all attacks made against a target at long range until the end of the character’s next turn.

Talent.Name: Hunter's Quarry (Improved)
Talent.Description: Suffer 2 strain to perform Hunter’s Quarry action as a maneuver.

Talent.Name: Bad Cop
Talent.Description: Spend [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] from a Deception or Coercion check to upgrade ability of an ally’s subsequent social check against the same target a number of times equal to ranks in Bad Cop.

Talent.Name: Biggest Fan
Talent.Description: Once per session, may take a Biggest Fan action; make a [DI][DI][DI] Charm check to turn one NPC into the character’s biggest fan.

Talent.Name: Congenial
Talent.Description: As an incidental, suffer strain up to ranks in Congenial to downgrade difficulty when making or upgrade difficulty when targeted by a Charm or Negotiation check.

Talent.Name: Coordination Dodge
Talent.Description: When targeted by a combat check, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add [FAILURE] equal to ranks in Coordination to check.

Talent.Name: Distracting Behavior
Talent.Description: As a maneuver, suffer strain up to ranks in Cunning. Until start of next turn, equal number of engaged NPCs suffer [THREAT] on checks. Ranks increase range.

Talent.Name: Distracting Behavior (Improved)
Talent.Description: The Distracting Behavior maneuver inflicts [THREAT][THREAT] on NPC’s checks when NPCs target character’s allies.

Talent.Name: Deceptive Taunt
Talent.Description: Once per session, may make Deceptive Taunt action; make opposed Deception check to force one adversary to attack the character on the adversary’s next turn.

Talent.Name: Good Cop
Talent.Description: Spend [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] from a Charm or Negotiation check to upgrade ability of an ally’s subsequent social check against the same target a number of times equal to ranks in Good Cop.

Talent.Name: Natural Athlete
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Athletics or Coordination check.

Talent.Name: Natural Merchant
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Streetwise or Negotiation check.

Talent.Name: Throwing Credits
Talent.Description: At the beginning of a session, spend 100 credits to ignore the strain threshold penalty due to a triggered Obligation.

Talent.Name: Unrelenting Skeptic (Improved)
Talent.Description: When targeted by a Deception check that fails, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add [DESPAIR] to results.

Talent.Name: Works Like a Charm
Talent.Description: Once per session, make one skill check, using Presence rather than the characteristic linked to that skill.

Talent.Name: Call 'Em
Talent.Description: Do not add [SETBACK] to combat checks due to the use of the Aim maneuver.

Talent.Name: Disarming Smile
Talent.Description: Take the Disarming Smile action; succeed at an opposed Charm check to lower the target’s defense rating by ranks in Disarming Smile until the ned of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Don't Shoot!
Talent.Description: Once per session as an action, make a [DI][DI][DI] Charm check. On success, cannot be the target of combat checks until the end of the encounter or until making a combat check.

Talent.Name: Double or Nothing
Talent.Description: Suffer 2 strain to perform the Double or Nothing incidental; Increase the difficulty of the next check by one. Then after canceling opposing symbols, double the remaining [ADVANTAGE].

Talent.Name: Double or Nothing (Improved)
Talent.Description: When performing the Double or Nothing incidental, after canceling opposing symbols, also double the remaining [SUCCESS].

Talent.Name: Double or Nothing (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When performing the Double or Nothing incidental, also double the number of [TRIUMPH] and [DESPAIR].

Talent.Name: Fortune Favors the Bold
Talent.Description: Once per session as an incidental, suffer 2 strain to flip one dark side Destiny Point to light side.

Talent.Name: Guns Blazing
Talent.Description: As an incidental, suffer 2 strain to avoid increasing the difficulty of a Ranged (Light) check to attack with both weapons.

Talent.Name: Just Kidding!
Talent.Description: Once per round as an incidental, spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore [DESPAIR] generated on a social check by the character or any ally in short range.

Talent.Name: Quick Draw (Improved)
Talent.Description: May use Quick Draw twice per round.

Talent.Name: Second Chances
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, choose a number of positive dice equal to ranks in Second Chances and re-roll them.

Talent.Name: Sorry About the Mess
Talent.Description: Decrease the Critical Rating of a weapon by 1 (minimum 1) against targets that have not yet acted this encounter.

Talent.Name: Spitfire
Talent.Description: After a successful combine check with two Ranged (Light) weapons, additional hits can be allocated to other targets within range of the weapon.

Talent.Name: Up the Ante
Talent.Description: When gambling, win 10% more credits per rank of Up the Ante.

Talent.Name: Body Guard (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session, when an ally protected by the Body Guard maneuver suffers a hit, suffer the hit instead.

Talent.Name: Eye for Detail
Talent.Description: After making a Mechanics or Computers check, may suffer strain up to ranks in Eye for Detail to convert that many [SUCCESS] to [ADVANTAGE].

Talent.Name: Machine Mender
Talent.Description: When making a Mechanics check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional wound per rank of Machine Mender.

Talent.Name: Reroute Processors
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, as an action make a [DI][DI] Computers check to reduce one of a droid’s characteristics by 1 and increase another by 1.

Talent.Name: All-Terrain Driver
Talent.Description: Do not suffer usual penalties for driving through difficult terrain when using Piloting (Planetary).

Talent.Name: Bought Info
Talent.Description: Instead of making a Knowledge check, may take a Bought Info action; spend credits equal to 50 times the difficulty of the check to pass with one [SUCCESS].

Talent.Name: Debilitating Shot
Talent.Description: Upon successful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, may spend [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] to reduce the target’s maximum speed by 1 until the end of the next round

Talent.Name: Overwhelm Defenses
Talent.Description: Upon unsuccessful attack with a starship or vehicle weapon, spend [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] per rank of talent to reduce the defense in the targeted zone by 1 for each [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] spent.

Talent.Name: Parry
Talent.Description: When hit by a melee attack while wielding a melee weapon or lightsaber, suffer 3 strain to reduce damage by 2 plus ranks in Parry.

Talent.Name: Informant
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reveal a contact who can shed light on a chosen subject.

Talent.Name: Grapple
Talent.Description: Once per round, may perform the Grapple maneuver. Until the beginning of the character’s next turn, foes must spend 2 maneuvers to disengage the character.

Talent.Name: Overbalance
Talent.Description: When a combat check made by an engaged foe generates [DESPAIR] or [THREAT][THREAT][THREAT], may stagger attacker until the end of his next turn.

Talent.Name: Precision Strike
Talent.Description: When this character inflicts a Critical Injury with a Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber weapon, may suffer 1 strain to change the result to any Easy ([DI]) Critical Injury result.

Talent.Name: Mind Over Matter
Talent.Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to recover strain equal to Willpower rating.

Talent.Name: Planet Mapper
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Planet Mapper from Streetwise or Survival checks used for navigation on a planet. Such checks take half normal time.

Talent.Name: Reconstruct the Scene
Talent.Description: As an action make a [DI][DI][DI] Perception check to identify the physical characteristics of a person present at a scene within 24 hours.

Talent.Name: Street Smarts (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session, as an action make a [DI][DI][DI][DI][DI] Streetwise or Knowledge (Underworld) check to learn one clue. Reduce the difficulty by 1 per rank of Street Smarts.

Talent.Name: Hard-Boiled
Talent.Description: When recovering strain after an encounter, may spend [ADVANTAGE] up to ranks in Hard Boiled to recover 1 wound per [ADVANTAGE] spent.

Talent.Name: Hindering Shot
Talent.Description: increase the difficulty of the next Gunnery check by 1 if check deals damage, target starship or vehicle suffers system strain equal to its speed when it moves until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Iron Body
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Iron Body from Coordination and Resilinece checks. Reduce the critical rating of unarmed attacks per rank of Iron Body (min 1).

Talent.Name: Martial Grace
Talent.Description: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to add damage equal to ranks in Coordination to the next Brawl check made this turn.

Talent.Name: Offensive Driving
Talent.Description: As a maneuver, suffer system strain up to the vehicle’s highest defense to upgrade the difficulty of target’s next Piloting check that many times.

Talent.Name: Precision Strike (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per round, when inflicting a Critical Injury with a Brawl or Melee weapon, suffer 2 strain to change the result to any [DI][DI] Critical Injury.

Talent.Name: Precision Strike (Supreme)
Talent.Description: Once per session, when inflicting a Critical Injury with an unarmed attack, suffer 3 strain to change the result to any [DI][DI][DI] Critical Injury.

Talent.Name: Unarmed Parry
Talent.Description: May Parry while unarmed. Reduce the strain cost to Parry while unarmed by 1 (minimum 1).

Talent.Name: Speaks Binary
Talent.Description: When directing NPC droids, may grant them [BOOST] per rank of Speaks Binary on checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Fancy Paint Job
Talent.Description: Upgrade all Charm, Deception, and Negotiation checks made in the presence of the Signature Vehicle once.

Talent.Name: Larger Project
Talent.Description: Signature Vehicle can have a silhouette 1 larger per rank of Larger Project.

Talent.Name: Signature Vehicle
Talent.Description: Choose one starship or vehicle with a silhouette of 3 or lower as a Signature Vehicle. Upgrade all Mechanics checks made on that vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Upgrade the ability of all Mechanics checks made to work on this vehicle once.

Talent.Name: Custom Loadout
Talent.Description: May add 2 additional hard points to Signature Vehicle.

Talent.Name: Cyberneticist
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Cyberneticist from checks to build, repair, and install cybernetic implants. Cybernetics cost 50% less (does not stack).

Talent.Name: Deft Maker
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Deft Maker from checks to repair, modify, construct, or program droids. Reduce the material cost to craft droids by 50% (does not stack).

Talent.Name: Engineered Redundancies
Talent.Description: Gain the ability to use emergency repair patches to heal. Additionally can be healed with Mechanics checks.

Talent.Name: Energy Transfer
Talent.Description: May suffer 1 strain to use the Energy Transfer maneuver to power up an unpowered device or replenish exhausted ammunition for an energy weapon.

Talent.Name: More Machine Than Man
Talent.Description: Increase cybernetic implant cap by 1 per rank of More Machine than Man.

Talent.Name: Overcharge
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, as an action make a [DI][DI][DI] Mechanics check. On a success one installed cybernetic implant provides additional benefits. On [DESPAIR] overcharged implant shorts out.

Talent.Name: Overcharge (Improved)
Talent.Description: May spend [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] or [TRIUMPH] from Overcharge action to immediately take another action.

Talent.Name: Supreme Overcharge
Talent.Description: May perform the Overcharge action on any number of installed cybernetic implants. On [DESPAIR], one implant shorts out.

Talent.Name: Resourceful Refit
Talent.Description: As an action make a [DI][DI] Mechanics check to scavenge an old attachment to construct a new one, reducing its price by that of the dismantled attachment.

Talent.Name: Speaks Binary (Improved)
Talent.Description: When directing NPC droids, those droids grant an additional [BOOST] in addition to other benefits.

Talent.Name: Speaks Binary (Supreme)
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, as a maneuver allow a number of droids up to ranks in Speaks Binary to use the character’s ranks in 1 skill of their choice.

Talent.Name: Grit
Talent.Description: Gain +1 strain threshold.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Lethal Blows
Talent.Description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury result inflicted on opponents.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stalker
Talent.Description: Add [BOOST] per rank of Stalker to all Stealth and Coordination checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Dodge
Talent.Description: When targeted in combat, may perform a Dodge incidental. Suffer strain no greater than ranks in Dodge to upgrade the difficulty of the attack by that number.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Precise Aim
Talent.Description: Once per round, may perform a Precise Aim maneuver. Suffer strain up to ranks in Precise Aim and reduce target’s Melee and Ranged Defense by that number.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Jump Up
Talent.Description: Once per round, may stand from seated or prone as an incidental.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Quick Strike
Talent.Description: Add [BOOST] per rank of Quick Strike to combat checks against targets that have not acted yet this encounter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Quick Draw
Talent.Description: Once per round, draw or holster a weapon or item as an incidental.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Targeted Blow
Talent.Description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add Agility in damage to one hit.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Sniper Shot
Talent.Description: Before making a nonthrown ranged attack, as a maneuver increase the weapon’s range by up to 1 band per rank. Upgrade the attack’s difficulty by 1 per range increase.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Deadly Accuracy
Talent.Description: When acquired, choose 1 combat skill. Add damage equal to ranks in that skill to one hit of a successful attack with that skill.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Dedication
Talent.Description: Gain +1 to a single characteristic. This cannot bring a characteristic above 6.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master of Shadows
Talent.Description: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease difficulty of next Stealth or Skulduggery check by 1.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Brace
Talent.Description: Perform the Brace maneuver to remove [SETBACK] per rank of Brace from your next Action. This may only remove [SETBACK] added by environmental circumstances

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Toughened
Talent.Description: Gain +2 wound threshold.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Intimidating
Talent.Description: May suffer a number of strain up to ranks in Intimidating to downgrade difficulty of Coercion checks or upgrade difficulty when targeted by Coercion checks by an equal number.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Defensive Stance
Talent.Description: Once per round, as a maneuver suffer a number of strain up to ranks in Defensive Stance to upgrade difficulty of all incoming melee attacks by an equal number for the next round.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Spare Clip
Talent.Description: Cannot run out of ammo due to [DESPAIR]. Items with Limited Ammo quality run out of ammo as normal.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Jury Rigged
Talent.Description: Choose 1 weapon, armor, or other item and give it a permanent improvement while it remains in use.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Point Blank
Talent.Description: Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of one hit of successful Ranged (Heavy) or (Light) attacks made while at short range or engaged.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Disorient
Talent.Description: After hitting with a combat check, may spend [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] to disorient target for a number of rounds equal to ranks in Disorient.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Armor Master
Talent.Description: When wearing armor, increase total soak value by 1.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Enforcer
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Coercion or Streetwise check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stunning Blow
Talent.Description: When making Melee checks, may inflict damage as strain instead of wounds. This does not ignore soak.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stunning Blow (Improved)
Talent.Description: When dealing strain damage with Melee or Brawl checks, may spend [TRIUMPH] to stagger target for 1 round per [TRIUMPH].

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Tinkerer
Talent.Description: May add 1 additional hard point to a number of items equal to ranks in Tinkerer. Each item may only be modified once.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Armor Master (Improved)
Talent.Description: When wearing armor with a soak value of 2 or higher, increase defense by 1.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Crippling Blow
Talent.Description: Increase the difficulty of next combat check by 1. If check deals damage, target suffers 1 strain whenever he moves for the remainder of the encounter

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Forager
Talent.Description: Remove up to [SETBACK][SETBACK] from skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the time

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Outdoorsman
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Outdoorsman from checks to move through terrain or manage environmental effects. Decrease overland travel times by half

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Expert Tracker
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Expert Tracker from checks to find tracks or track targets. Decrease time to track a target by half.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Soft Spot
Talent.Description: After making a successful attack, may spend 1 Destiny Point to add damage equal to Cunning to one hit.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hunter
Talent.Description: Add [BOOST] per rank of Hunter to all checks when interacting with beasts or animals (including combat). Add +10 to Critical Injury results against beasts or animals per rank of Hunter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Swift
Talent.Description: Do not suffer usual penalties for moving through difficult terrain.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Outdoorsman
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Resilience or Survival check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Blooded
Talent.Description: Add [BOOST] per rank of Blooded to all checks to resist or recover from poisons, venoms, or toxins. Reduce duration of ongoing poisons by one round per rank of Blooded to a minimum of 1.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Enduring
Talent.Description: Gain +1 soak value.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Heroic Fortitude
Talent.Description: May spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Brawn or Agility checks until the end of the encounter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Brawler
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Brawl or Melee check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Galaxy Mapper
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Galaxy Mapper from Astrogation checks. Astrogation checks take half normal time.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Full Throttle
Talent.Description: Take a Full Throttle action; make a [DI][DI][DI] Piloting check to increase a vehicle’s top speed by 1 for a number of rounds equal to Cunning.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Skilled Jockey
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Skilled Jockey from all Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Let's Ride
Talent.Description: Once per round, may mount or dismount a vehicle or beast, or enter a cockpit or weapon station on a vehicle, as an incidental.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Bypass Security
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Bypass Security from checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Rapid Recovery
Talent.Description: When healing strain after an encounter, heal 1 additional strain per rank of Rapid Recovery.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Street Smarts
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Street Smarts from Streetwise or Knowledge (Underworld) checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Nobody's Fool
Talent.Description: May upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks once per rank of Nobody’s Fool.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Surgeon
Talent.Description: When making a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional wound per rank of Surgeon.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Bacta Specialist
Talent.Description: Patients recover 1 additional wound per rank of Bacta Specialist when they recover wounds from bacta tanks or long term care

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Resolve
Talent.Description: When a character involuntarily suffers strain, he suffers 1 less strain per rank of Resolve, minimum 1.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stim Application
Talent.Description: Take the Stim Application action; make a [DI][DI] Medicine check. If successful, 1 engaged ally increases 1 characteristic by 1 for the encounter and suffers 4 strain.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stim Application (Improved)
Talent.Description: When performing a Stim Application action, may increase the difficulty to [DI][DI][DI], and target only suffers 1 strain.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stim Application (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When performing the Stim Application action, spend [TRIUMPH] to increase an additional Characteristic by 1.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Pressure Point
Talent.Description: When making a Brawl check against an opponent, instead of dealing damage, may deal equivalent strain plus additional strain equal to ranks in Medicine (ignoring soak).
Talent.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Doctor
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Medicine check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Kill With Kindness
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Kill with Kindness from all Charm and Leadership checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Plausible Deniability
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Plausible Deniability from all Coercion and Deception checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Scathing Tirade
Talent.Description: Take a Scathing Tirade action; make a [DI][DI] Coercion check. One enemy for each [SUCCESS], in short range, suffers 1 strain. Spend [ADVANTAGE] for 1 affected enemy to suffer 1 additional strain.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Scathing Tirade (Improved)
Talent.Description: Each enemy affected by Scathing Tirade suffers [SETBACK] on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to ranks in Coercion.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Scathing Tirade (Supreme)
Talent.Description: Suffer 1 strain to perform Scathing Tirade as a maneuver, not an action.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Inspiring Rhetoric
Talent.Description: Take an Inspiring Rhetoric action; make a [DI][DI] Leadership check. One ally for each [SUCCESS], in short range, recovers 1 strain. Spend [ADVANTAGE] for 1 affected ally to recover 1 additional strain.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Inspiring Rhetoric (Improved)
Talent.Description: Each ally affected by Inspiring Rhetoric gains [BOOST] on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to ranks in Leadership.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Inspiring Rhetoric (Supreme)
Talent.Description: Suffer 1 strain to perform Inspiring Rhetoric as a maneuver, not an action.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Steely Nerves
Talent.Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Willpower or Presence checks until the end of the encounter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Charmer
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Charm or Deception check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Intense Presence
Talent.Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to recover strain equal to Presence rating.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Respected Scholar
Talent.Description: May downgrade difficulty of checks to interact with institutes of learning by one level per rank of Respected Scholar.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Researcher
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Researcher from all Knowledge checks. Researching a subject takes half the time.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Codebreaker
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank in Codebreaker from checks to break codes or decrypt communications. Decrease difficulty of checks to break codes or decrypt communications by 1.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Knowledge Specialization
Talent.Description: When acquired, choose 1 Knowledge skill. When making that skill check, may spend [TRIUMPH] result to gain [SUCCESS] equal to ranks in Knowledge Specialization.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Scholar
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Knowledge skill check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Intense Focus
Talent.Description: Perform an Intense Focus maneuver; suffer 1 strain and upgrade the ability of the next skill check once.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Confidence
Talent.Description: May decrease difficulty of Discipline checks to avoid fear by 1 per rank of Confidence.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Stroke of Genius
Talent.Description: Once per session, make one skill check using Intellect rather than the characteristic linked to that skill.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Mental Fortress
Talent.Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore effects of Critical Injuries on Intellect or Cunning checks until end of encounter.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Sound Investments
Talent.Description: At the start of each session, gain 100 credits for each rank of Sound Investments.

Talent.Name: Greased Palms
Talent.Description: Before making a social check, may spend up to 50 credits per rank of Greased Palms to upgrade the ability of the check once for every 50 credits spent.

Talent.Name: Master Merchant
Talent.Description: When buying/selling goods, or paying off/taking more Obligation, suffer 2 strain to buy for 25% less, sell for 25% more, pay off 1 more Obligation, or take 1 less.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Know Somebody
Talent.Description: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, reduce its rarity by 1 per rank of Know Somebody.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hard Headed
Talent.Description: When staggered or disoriented, perform the Hard Headed action to make a [DI][DI][DI][DI] Discipline check to remove the status. Difficulty reduced by 1 per rank.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Durable
Talent.Description: May reduce any Critical Injury suffered by 10 per rank of Durable to a minimum of 1.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hard Headed (Improved)
Talent.Description: When incapacitated due to strain exceeding threshold, take a [DI][DI][DI][DI][DI] Discipline check (–[DI] per rank of Hard Headed) to reduce strain to 1 below threshold.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Marksman
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Smooth Talker
Talent.Description: When first acquired, choose Charm, Coercion, Deception, or Negotiation. When making checks with that skill, spend [TRIUMPH] to gain additional [SUCCESS] equal to ranks in Smooth Talker.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Convincing Demeanor
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Convincing Demeanor from Deception or Skulduggery checks

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Second Wind
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, may use Second Wind incidental to heal strain equal to ranks in Second Wind.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Starhopper
Talent.Description: Once per round, suffer 2 strain to decrease the difficulty of next Astrogation check by 1 to a minimum of [DI].

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Defensive Driving
Talent.Description: Increase defense of vehicle or starship being piloted by 1 per rank of Defensive Driving.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Knockdown
Talent.Description: After hitting with a melee attack, may spend [TRIUMPH] to knock the target prone.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Familiar Suns
Talent.Description: Once per session, as a maneuver make a [DI][DI][DI] Knowledge (Outer Rim) or (Core Worlds) check to reveal the current type of environment and other useful information.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Heightened Awareness
Talent.Description: Allies within short range add [BOOST] to Perception or Vigilance checks. Engaged allies add [BOOST][BOOST].

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Black Market Contacts
Talent.Description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank, increasing cost by 50% of base cost per reduction.
Talent.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Negotiator
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Cool or Negotiation check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Superior Reflexes
Talent.Description: Gain +1 melee defence.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Hunter
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Perception or Vigilance check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Fine Tuning
Talent.Description: When reducing the amount of system strain a starship or vehicle suffers, reduce 1 additional strain per rank of Fine Tuning.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Gearhead
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per rank of Gearhead from Mechanics checks. Halve the credit cost to add mods to attachments.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Tricky Target
Talent.Description: Count vehicle or starship piloted as having a silhouette 1 lower when being attacked.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Driver
Talent.Description: Once per round when driving a vehicle, may suffer 2 strain to perform any action as a maneuver.

Talent.Name: Barrage
Talent.Description: Add 1 damage per rank of Barrage to 1 hit of a successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery at long or extreme range.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Body Guard
Talent.Description: Once per round, perform a maneuver to guard an engaged ally. Suffer strain up to ranks to upgrade difficulty of attacks against them by that number until the start of next turn.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Side Step
Talent.Description: Once per round, as a maneuver suffer a number of strain up to ranks in Side Step to upgrade difficulty of all incoming ranged attacks by an equal number for the next round.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Frenzied Attack
Talent.Description: When making a Melee or Brawl attack, suffer strain up to ranks in Frenzied Attack to upgrade the attack by an equal amount.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Feral Strength
Talent.Description: Add 1 damage per rank of Feral Strength to one hit of a successful Melee or Brawl attack.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Command
Talent.Description: Add [BOOST] per rank of Command to Leadership checks. Affected targets add [BOOST] to Discipline checks for the next 24 hours.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Strong Arm
Talent.Description: Treat thrown weapons as if they had 1 greater range.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Field Commander
Talent.Description: Take the Field Commander action; make a [DI][DI] Leadership check. A number of allies equal to Presence may immediately suffer 1 strain to perform 1 free maneuver.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Field Commander (Improved)
Talent.Description: Field Commander action affects allies equal to double Presence, and may spend [TRIUMPH] to allow allies to suffer 1 strain to perform 1 action instead.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Fearsome
Talent.Description: When an enemy becomes engaged with the character, they may force the enemy to make a fear check, with the difficulty equal to ranks in Fearsome.

Talent.Name: Powerful Blast
Talent.Description: Increase Blast damage dealt by explosives, explosive weapons, and grenades by +1 per rank of Powerful Blast.

Talent.Name: Selective Detonation
Talent.Description: When using a weapon with the Blast quality, spend [ADVANTAGE] to exclude 1 target that would be affected by the explosion, up to ranks in Selective Detonation.

Talent.Name: Time to Go
Talent.Description: The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Move maneuver as an incidental to attempt to move into cover or out of the blast range of a weapon or explosion.

Talent.Name: Time to Go (Improved)
Talent.Description: When activating Time to Go, allow 1 engaged ally to perform an out of turn Move maneuver as an incidental to move into cover or out of a blast range.

Talent.Name: Dead to Rights
Talent.Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to half Agility (round up) to one hit of a successful attack made with ship- or vehicle-mounted weaponry.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Dead to Rights (Improved)
Talent.Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to add additional damage equal to Agility to one hit of a successful attack made with ship- or vehiclemounted weaponry.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Pilot
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Piloting (Space) or Gunnery check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Pilot
Talent.Description: Once per round when driving a starship, may suffer 2 strain to perform any action as a maneuver.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Brilliant Evasion
Talent.Description: Once per encounter may take Brilliant Evasion action. Select 1 opponent and make an Opposed Piloting check to stop opponent from attacking character for rounds equal to Agility.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hidden Storage
Talent.Description: Gain hidden storage in vehicles or equipment that holds items with total encumbrance equal to ranks in Hidden Storage.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Indistinguishable
Talent.Description: Upgrade difficulty of checks to identify character once per rank of Indistinguishable.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Rogue
Talent.Description: Once per session re-roll any 1 Skulduggery or Stealth check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Rapid Reaction
Talent.Description: Suffer a number of strain up to ranks in Rapid Reaction to add an equal number of [SUCCESS] to initiative checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Solid Repairs
Talent.Description: The character repairs 1 additional hull trauma per rank of Solid Repairs whenever he repairs a starship or vehicle.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Redundant Systems
Talent.Description: Once per session, as an action, make a [DI] Mechanics check to harvest components from a functioning device, without breaking it, to repair a broken one.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Bad Motivator
Talent.Description: Once per session, may take a Bad Motivator action; make a [DI][DI][DI] Mechanics check to cause one targeted device to spontaneously fail.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Contraption
Talent.Description: Once per session, take a Contraption action; make a [DI][DI][DI] Mechancs check to fashion a device to solve a current problem using just the tools and parts on hand.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Tinkerer
Talent.Description: Once per session, re-roll any 1 Mechanics check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hold Together
Talent.Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to perform a Hold Together incidental immediately after vehicle or starship takes damage to turn it to system strain.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Inventor
Talent.Description: When constructing new items or modifying attachments, add [BOOST] or remove [SETBACK] per rank of Inventor.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Known Schematic
Talent.Description: Once per session, may perform the Known Schematic maneuver; make a [DI][DI][DI] Knowledge (Education) check to gain familiarity with a building or ship’s design.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Technical Aptitude
Talent.Description: Reduce time needed to complete Computerrelated tasks by 25% per rank in Technical Aptitude.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Defensive Slicing
Talent.Description: When defending computer systems, add [SETBACK] per rank of Defensive Slicing to opponents’ checks.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Defensive Slicing (Improved)
Talent.Description: Defensive Slicing now upgrades opponents; difficulty once per rank of Defensive Slicing; this replaces the usual benefits

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Programmer
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll any 1 Computers or Astrogation check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Skilled Slicer
Talent.Description: When making a Computers check may spend [TRIUMPH] to make further Computers checks within this system as maneuvers.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Master Slicer
Talent.Description: Once per round, may take a Master Slicer incidental to suffer 2 strain and decrease difficulty of Computers or other slicing checks by 1, minimum [DI].

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Insight
Talent.Description: Perception and Discipline become career skills.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Overwhelming Aura (Improved)
Talent.Description: Characters affected by Overwhelming Aura add automatic [FA] to fear checks the character causes and automatic [SU] to fear checks not caused by the character.

Talent.Name: Blooded (Improved)
Talent.Description: As an action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b] to immediately recover from the effects of all poisons and side effects of drugs. Reduce the difficulty once per rank of Blooded.

Talent.Name: Font of Power
Talent.Description: Once per game session, may take the Font of Power action. Until the end of the encounter, characters within medium range add automatic [LI] or [DA] to checks based on alignment.

Talent.Name: Identify Ingredients
Talent.Description: After being exposed to a substance as an out of turn incidental, may roll [FO] no greater than Force rating. Spend [FP][FP] to immediately identify its composition and effects.

Talent.Name: Improvised Concoction
Talent.Description: Once per session, as an action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Xenology) check,[b] adding [FO] no greater than Force rating to create 1 dose of a poison or drug with a rarity of Intellect + [SU] + [FP] spent or lower.

Talent.Name: Overwhelming Aura
Talent.Description: Commit [FO]. Add [AD] to social checks equal to [FO] committed. Add [TH] equal to [FO] committed to enemy social checks in short range.

Talent.Name: Power of Darkness
Talent.Description: Once per session, may perform the Power of Darkness maneuver. Increase wound threshold by 1 per Dark Side destiny point currently in the Destiny pool until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Alchemical Arts
Talent.Description: After making a check to craft a potion or talisman, may suffer strain up to twice ranks in Alchemical Arts. For every two strain, add [LI] or [DA] to the results.

Talent.Name: Channel Agony
Talent.Description: After rolling [FO], may suffer wounds up to twice ranks in Channel Agony to add automatic [DA] for every two wounds suffered to the results.

Talent.Name: Secret Lore
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Secret Lore from all Knowledge (Lore) checks. Reduce the difficulty of all Knowledge (Lore) checks by 1.

Talent.Name: Transmogrify
Talent.Description: When making a Crafting check, may add [FO] no greater than Force rating. Spend [FP] to add [SU] and spend [FP][FP] to add [AD] to check.

Talent.Name: Disciple of Lore
Talent.Description: Once per round, suffer 1 strain to reduce the difficulty of the next Knowledge (Lore) check a number of times equal to ranks in Disciple of Lore.

Talent.Name: Push Aside
Talent.Description: After making a successful Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber combat check against an engaged foe, may force the foe to move to short range in a direction of the opponent's choosing. Spend [TR] to cause the opponent to fall prone after moving.

Talent.Name: As the Force Wills It
Talent.Description: Make an [B]Easy ([DI]) Knowledge Lore check[b] to heal strain at the end of the encounter. [TR] can be spent to heal all strain.

Talent.Name: Extended Reach
Talent.Description: While armed with a two-handed melee weapon, may suffer one strain to make a melee combat check with that weapon targeting an enemy at up to short range (rather than engaged range).

Talent.Name: Disciplined Soul
Talent.Description: Spend one Destiny Point after making a Discipline Check to spend a number of [TH] not exceeding ranks in Knowledge (Lore) as [AD],

Talent.Name: Know the Enemy
Talent.Description: The character may use Knowledge (Warfare) skill when making checks to determine initiative.

Talent.Name: By the Book
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, before making a combat check, the character may suffer two strain to add [AD] to the results equall to his ranks in By the Book.

Talent.Name: Formation Tactics
Talent.Description: May take the Formation Tactics action by making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, he may choose a number of allies within short range equal to [SU] generated. Upgrade the difficulty of attacks against these allies once until the end of his next turn.

Talent.Name: Formation Tactics (Improved)
Talent.Description: The difficulty of Formation Tactics is reduced to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b]. May spend [TR] or [AD][AD][AD][AD][AD][AD] to have effect last until the end of encounter.

Talent.Name: Targeted Firepower
Talent.Description: Once per session may take Targeted Firepower action; identify one enemy target and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge Warfare check[b]. If successful, for the rest of the encounter allies within short range of character add [AD] to attacks against target equal to [SU] gained in the check.

Talent.Name: Disorienting Stirke
Talent.Description: After failing a Lightsaber combat check, may spend [AD][AD] or [TR] to disorient opponent for three rounds.

Talent.Name: Temple Training
Talent.Description: Before making a Lightsaber skill check, the character may spend on Destiny Point to add damage to the attack equal to his ranks in Knowledge (Lore).

Talent.Name: Trust No One
Talent.Description: When targeted by a social check, may chose to suffer one strain to add automatic [FA] to the check. If the check fails with [DE], the character may immediately perform a maneuver as an out of turn incidental.

Talent.Name: Know the Ropes
Talent.Description: Add [BO] to the checks made to escape from restraints equal to ranks in Knowledge (Underworld). Spend [TR] to free all other allies within short range.

Talent.Name: Fearsome Rep
Talent.Description: Add automatic [AD] to the results of Coercion checks equal to ranks in Fearsome Rep.

Talent.Name: Double-Talk
Talent.Description: The character may spend [AD][AD] or [TR] from a successful Charm or Deception check to disorient a number of opponents within short range equal to his Presence for remainder of round and next two rounds.

Talent.Name: Prepare to be Boarded!
Talent.Description: Once per encounter may take Prepare to be Boarded! action and make [B]opposed Coercion vs. Discipline check[b] against enemy ship captain. If successful, the enemy suffers 1 strain per uncanceled [SU] and surrenders ship if he exceeds strain threshold. May also spend [TR] or [AD][AD][AD][AD] to inflict strain equal to ranks in Coercion.

Talent.Name: Altered Deal
Talent.Description: Once per session amy take the Altered Deal action and make [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) check[b] to radically change a previously made deal or bargain to the character's advantage.

Talent.Name: Steady Aim
Talent.Description: The character does not lose the benefits of Aim maneuver if hs performs other maneuvers (including moving) or actions. He does lose the benefits of the Aim maneuver if the encounter ends.

Talent.Name: Combat Veteran
Talent.Description: The character adds [BO] to his Brawl and Discipline checks equal to his ranks in Combat Veteran.

Talent.Name: Persistent Targeting
Talent.Description: After making one or more successful combat checks against a target, add [BO] to combat checks against that same target for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Comrades in Arms
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, take Comrade in Arms action and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Discipline check[b]. If successful, the characgter plus one ally per [SU] within medium range gains +1 defense for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Comrades in Arms (Improved)
Talent.Description: Enter description for Talent "Comrades in Arms (Improved)" here.

Talent.Name: Pride and Joy
Talent.Description: Choose one starship or vehicle character owns with a silhouette of 4 or higher; it becomes his "Pride and Joy" vessel. He upgrades the ability of all social skill checks he makes while short range of the vessel once.

Talent.Name: Trust the Captain
Talent.Description: May take the Trust the Captain action by making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, for the rest of the encounter allies within short range increase their ranks in Discipline by an amount equal to ranks in Trust the Captain.

Talent.Name: Most Impressive
Talent.Description: Spend [TR] from any skill check to allow a number of allies not exceeding the character's rating in Presence within short range to add automatic [AD] to their next check.

Talent.Name: Inspiring Leadership
Talent.Description: Take the Inspiring Leadership action by making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, a number of allies not exceeding his rating in Presence within short range add automatic [SU] to their next skill check.

Talent.Name: Secrets of the Jedi
Talent.Description: Lightsaber becomes a career skill. He may also decrease the difficulty of checks to made to construct or repair lightsaber hilts a number of times equal to half his ranks in Knowledge (Lore) (rounded up), to a minimum of [B]Easy ([DI])[b].

Talent.Name: Pride and Joy (Supreme)
Talent.Description: While inside his Pride and Joy Vessel, once per session as an incidental, the character may reduce its silhouette by 2 (to a minimum of 0) for the remainder of the round and the following round.

Talent.Name: Seen a Lot of Things
Talent.Description: Whenever the character fails a Knowledge check, he may spend [AD][AD][AD] to roll the check again during his next turn.

Talent.Name: Pride and Joy (Improved)
Talent.Description: While inside his Pride and Joy vessel, recover 1 additional strain whenever recovering strain and spend [AD] on checks made to recover strain to allow an ally also within the vessel to recover one strain.

Talent.Name: Headbutt
Talent.Description: Perform Headbutt incidental, suffering 2 wounds to knock down and disorient the enemy.

Talent.Name: Indomitable Will
Talent.Description: Once per encounter as a maneuver, suffer 3 strain to commit [FO] up to Force rating and reduce all damage by an equal amount, but suffer 1 strain each turn.

Talent.Name: Toughened (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session, may heal wounds equal to ranks in Toughened.

Talent.Name: Power from Pain
Talent.Description: Once per session as an incidental, may spend 1 Destiny Point to gain +1 Force Rating for each Critical Injury character is suffering until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Embrace Your Hate
Talent.Description: May spend 1 Destiny Point and then suffer Conflict equal to dark side Destiny Points in the pool to add equal damage to melee attack. May use this ability once per encounter per rank.

Talent.Name: Vaapad Control
Talent.Description: When making a Lightsaber combat check, the character may suffer 1 strain to downgrade the difficulty of of the check a number of times equal to the number of light side Destiny Points in the Destiny pool.

Talent.Name: Juyo Savagery
Talent.Description: The character adds +5 to Critical Injury rolls from Lightsaber attacks for each dark side Destiny Point in the Destiny pool.

Talent.Name: Dodge (Improved)
Talent.Description: After using Dodge, can make a Move maneuver as an out-of-turn incidental.

Talent.Name: Acklay's Scything Strike
Talent.Description: Brawl attacks gain Pierce equal to Force Rating.

Talent.Name: Sapith Sundering
Talent.Description: May add [FO] up to Force Rating to Brawl checks; the attack gains the Sunder quality, and character may quality, and character may spend [FP] generated on the check as [AD] to activate the Sunder quality.

Talent.Name: Inner Peace
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, convert a number of Destiny Points equal to ranks in Inner Peace to light side Destiny Points and reduce Conflict gained this session.

Talent.Name: Improvised Position
Talent.Description: The character may make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] to construct a secure position. This provides cover for the group and its vehicles.

Talent.Name: Push the Specs
Talent.Description: Perform the Push the Specs action when making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b]. With success, the ship's top speed increases by 1 for a number of rounds equal to the character's Intellect.

Talent.Name: Smart Handling
Talent.Description: Once per session, take the Smart Handling action; making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b]. Until start of the next round the ship's handling increases by 2 plus an amount equal to [AD] scored on the check to a maximum handling of +4.

Talent.Name: Master Demolitionist
Talent.Description: When resolving an attack from a personal explosive or ordance weapon, may spend [AD] or [TR] to have the weapon's Blast quality act at short range, or medium if it already act at short.

Talent.Name: Weak Foundation
Talent.Description: Once per session may take the Weak Foundation action; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check[b]. If successful, for the remainder of the encounter the character and all allies add automatic [AD][AD] or [SU] to all combat checks made targeting the identified fixed structure.

Talent.Name: Far Strike
Talent.Description: As an action, make a Brawl check as a ranged attack, adding [FO] up to Force rating. Increase the range of the attack by one band for each [FP] spent, to a maximum of long.

Talent.Name: Secrets of the Jedi (Improved)
Talent.Description: Discipline becomes a career skill. Secrets of the jedi may also be used when installing mods on lightsabers.

Talent.Name: Pilot Training
Talent.Description: Piloting (Planetary) and Pilot (Space) become career skills.

Talent.Name: Hidden Storage (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may use Hidden Storage to store an item within his own suitably modified body.

Talent.Name: Indistinguishable (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may extend the effects of Indistinguishable to a number of allies within short range equal to ranks in Deception.

Talent.Name: Lose Them
Talent.Description: When being followed or chased, the character may perform the Lose Them action and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Stealth check[b]. If successful, add [SE][SE] to checks to follow him for the remainder of the encounter and may spend [TR] to indicate his pursuers have lost him completely.

Talent.Name: Incite Distraction
Talent.Description: While in a crowd, may perform the Incite Distraction action to make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Deception check[b]. If successful, enemies treat the area as difficult terrain. The character may spend [TR] to make the location impassable terrain to them instead.

Talent.Name: Analyze Data
Talent.Description: Once per session, after capturing enemy data, the character may perform the Analyze Data action to make an [B] Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check[b]. Once during the remainder of the session he may then add [SU] equal to ranks in Knowledge (Warfare) to one check related to that data.

Talent.Name: A Step Ahead
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character may suffer 2 strain in order to count his Cunning as one higher than normal for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Inside Person
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character may spend a Destiny Point to establish he has previously been undercover gathering information in an identified enemy base or large vehicle. For the remainder of the session, add automatic [AD][AD] to checks he or his allies make that are associated with that location (such as checks to attack it or social skill checks targeting personnel in it).

Talent.Name: Inside Knowledge
Talent.Description: Once per session while in an enemy facility or vessel, may perform the Inside Knowledge action; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Skullduggery check[b]. Character may then find a single personal scale item with a rarity no greater than Cunning plus 2 previously stashed here, or gain a narrative benefit.

Talent.Name: Resist Questioning
Talent.Description: When targeted by an opposed social skill check, the character may suffer 2 strain to perform the Resist Questioning out-of-turn incidental, adding [SE] to the check. If the check fails, may spend [DE] to indicate he has provided false information to foe.

Talent.Name: Know Their Weakness (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may extend the effects of Know Their Weakness to a number of enemies within short range equal to his Presence.

Talent.Name: Know Their Weakness
Talent.Description: Once per session, may perform the Know Their Weakness action and choose one target within short range; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to downgrade the difficulty of social checks against target once per rank of Know Their Weakness until the end of the session.

Talent.Name: Resist Questioning (Improved)
Talent.Description: When one ally within short range is targeted by an opposed social skill check, the character may perform Resist Questioning to affect this check instead. If the check fails, may spend [DE] to indicate the ally provided false information to foe.

Talent.Name: Made You Talk
Talent.Description: Once per session, may make an opposed social skill check against a captured enemy character within short range and add [BO] for every 2 strain inflicted on the target that encounter. If successful, the PCs gain a bonus based on the enemy NPC type.

Talent.Name: Exhaustive Questioning
Talent.Description: Whenever character makes a successful social skill check against a captured enemy within short range, may reduce that enemy's strain threshold by 2 for the remainder of the session and can spend [AD] to inflict 1 strain.

Talent.Name: Cunning Persona
Talent.Description: The character may suffer 2 strain to make a Charm check with Cunning instead of Presence.

Talent.Name: Construction Specialist
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] equal to ranks in Construction Specialist from checks to construct defenses, posistions, fortifications, and similar projects.

Talent.Name: Creative Design
Talent.Description: As part of resolving a successful crafting check, the character may also apply a result equivalent to spending a number of [AD] equal to his ranks in Creative Design. The GM may then apply a result equivalent to spending that same number of [TH].

Talent.Name: Design Flaw
Talent.Description: When making a combat check with a personal scale weapon against a droid, may add [AD] equal to ranks of Design Flaw.

Talent.Name: Desperate Repairs
Talent.Description: Once per session may make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] on one engaged allied droid. If successful, the droid becomes immobilized and staggered for 1 round, then heals all strain and one Critical Injury with a severity rating no greater than [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b].

Talent.Name: Dockyard Expertise
Talent.Description: May make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b] when at a space dock. If successful, the cost and time for repairs is reduced by 25% per rank of Dockyard Expertise.

Talent.Name: Improvised Defenses
Talent.Description: May make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Survival check[b] to fashion small defenses. It provides cover for up to 4 characters for the rest of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Push the Specs
Talent.Description: Perform the Push the Specs action when making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b]. With success, the ship's top speed increases by 1 for a number of rounds equal to the character's Intellect.

Talent.Name: Repair Patch Specialization
Talent.Description: Whenever using an emergency repair patch, the target heals an additional wound per rank of Repair Patch Specialization.

Talent.Name: Smart Handling
Talent.Description: Once per session, take the Smart Handling action; making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b]. Until start of the next round the ship's handling increases by 2 plus an amount equal to [AD] scored on the check to a maximum handling of +4.

Talent.Name: Improvised Position
Talent.Description: The character may make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] to construct a secure position. This provides cover for the group and its vehicles.

Talent.Name: Combat Programming
Talent.Description: Once per encounter make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] while repairing or working on a droid. For the remainder of the encounter, the droid gains 1 rank in two different combat skills.

Talent.Name: Conditioned
Talent.Description: Remove [SETBACK] per of Conditioned from Athletics and Coordination checks. Reduce the damage and strain suffered from falling by 1 per rank of Conditioned.

Talent.Name: Body Guard (Supreme)
Talent.Description: Body Guard maneuver may protect a number of engaged characters up to ranks in Resilience.

Talent.Name: Moving Target
Talent.Description: If the character has already acted this round increase ranged defense by 1 per rank of Moving Target.

Talent.Name: Suppressing Fire
Talent.Description: Character and allies in short range may spend [ADVANTAGE] on failed combat checks once per round to inflict 1 strain per rank of Suppressing Fire on the target.

Talent.Name: Seize the Initiative
Talent.Description: Once per session, as a maneuver, may make a [B]Hard ([DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY]) Athletics check[b]. On Success other PCs may take their turns immediately.

Talent.Name: Dynamic Fire
Talent.Description: When making a ranged attack while engaged with an opponent, may suffer 2 strain to reduce the ranged modifier by 1.

Talent.Name: Physical Training
Talent.Description: Add [BOOST] per rank of Physical Training to Athletics and Resilience checks.

Talent.Name: Encouraging Words
Talent.Description: After an engaged ally fails a check, may suffer 1 strain to assist that ally's next check this encounter as an out of turn incidental.

Talent.Name: Master Instructor
Talent.Description: Once per round, as an out of turn incidental, may suffer 2 strain to allow ally to use character's ranks in Discipline for the next Discipline check they make.

Talent.Name: Natural Instructor
Talent.Description: Once per session, may re-roll one Discipline or Leadership check.

Talent.Name: That's How It's Done
Talent.Description: May suffer 1 strain on a successful skill check to add [ADVANTAGE] to the same skill check made during the next round by a number of allies in short range equal to Willpower.

Talent.Name: Stimpack Specialization
Talent.Description: Stimpacks heal 1 additional wound per rank of Stimpack Specialization.

Talent.Name: Discredit
Talent.Description: One per encounter, take the Discredit action: make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Deception check[b] to upgrade the difficulty of one character's social checks once, plus once for every [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Twisted Words
Talent.Description: When an incoming social check generates [THREAT][THREAT] or [DESPAIR], you may suffer 1 strain as an incidental to inflict strain equal to ranks in Coersion on speaker.

Talent.Name: Blackmail
Talent.Description: When an NPC exceeds his strain threshold, you may spend 1 Destiny Point to convince that NPC to perform a single task of choice instead.

Talent.Name: Supporting Evidence
Talent.Description: When assisting an ally with Charm, Deception, Leadership, or Negotiation checks add automatic [ADVANTAGE] per rank of Supporting Evidence.

Talent.Name: Plausible Deniability (Improved)
Talent.Description: Take an Improved Plausible Deniability action to make a [B] Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Coercion check[b] to convince one bystander per rank of Plausible Deniability to depart quietly.

Talent.Name: Interjection
Talent.Description: After another character makes a social check, suffer 3 strain to take an Interjection incidental make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Vigilance check[b] to add [SUCCESS] or [FAILURE] equal to [SUCCESS] and [ADVANTAGE] or [THREAT] equal to [ADVANTAGE] to the check.

Talent.Name: Contingency Plan
Talent.Description: Spend 1 Destiny Point to recover strain equal to Cunning rating.

Talent.Name: Incite Rebellion
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character can take an Incite Rebellion action to make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Coercion check[b]. If successful, a number of beings up to ranks in Coercion to become rebellious until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Sense Danger
Talent.Description: Once per session, remove [SETBACK][SETBACK] from any 1 check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Sense Advantage
Talent.Description: Once per session, may add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to 1 NPC's skill check.

Talent.Name: Forewarning
Talent.Description: Perform the Forewarning action, all allies within medium range increase defense by character's Force rating until the act in the encounter.

Talent.Name: Preemptive Avoidance
Talent.Description: May spend 1 Destiny Point to disengage from engaged enemy as an out-of-turn incidental.

Talent.Name: Force Rating
Talent.Description: Gain +1 Force rating.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Natural Mystic
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Force power check.

Talent.Name: The Force Is My Ally
Talent.Description: Once per session, may suffer 2 strain to perform Force power action as maneuver.

Talent.Name: Terrifying Kill
Talent.Description: The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to take the Terrifying Kill maneuver after incapacitating or inflicting a Critical Injury. Roll [FORCE] no greater than Force rating and spend [FP] to inflict 1 strain on each character within short range of the target.

Talent.Name: Essential Kill
Talent.Description: When making a non-Gunnary combat check, the character may add [FORCE] no greater than his Force rating to the check. The character may spend [FP] to add [ADVANTAGE], or [FP][FP][FP] to add [TRIUMPH] to the result.

Talent.Name: Marked for Death
Talent.Description: Take the Marked for Death maneuver, commiting [FORCE]. Add [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] to combat checks against target while [FORCE] remains committed, but cannot use this talent again until the original target is incapacitated or the session ends.

Talent.Name: Deathblow
Talent.Description: After making a successful attack with a non-starship/vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Willpower to one hit of the successful attack.

Talent.Name: Unstoppable
Talent.Description: If a Critical Injury roll is 1 or reduced to 1, do not receive the critical injury.

Talent.Name: Sleight of Mind
Talent.Description: Add [BOOST] to all Stealth checks unless the opposition is immune to Force powers.

Talent.Name: Shroud
Talent.Description: The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to make himself undetectable via Force powers and make his own powers go unnoticed for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Slippery Minded
Talent.Description: If under the effects of a Force power, perform the Slippery Minded action; make a [B] Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Deception check[b] to immediately end effects of the power.

Talent.Name: Now You See Me
Talent.Description: Once per session, takt the Now You See Me action. Make a [B] HARD ([DI][DI][DI]) Deception check[b] to make a number of NPCs equal to Cunning with medium range forget about your character.

Talent.Name: Parry (Improved)
Talent.Description: When parrying a hit that generated [DESPAIR] or [THREAT][THREAT][THREAT], may hit attacker once wish Lightstaber, Brawl, or Melee weapon (dealing base damager), after original attack resolves.

Talent.Name: Reflect
Talent.Description: When hit by a ranged attack while wielding a lightsaber, suffer 3 strain to reduce damage by 2 plus ranks in Reflect.

Talent.Name: Ataru Technique
Talent.Description: When making a check using the Lightsaber skill, the character may use Agility instead of Brawn.

Talent.Name: Saber Swarm
Talent.Description: As a maneuver, spend 1 strain to give the next Lightsaber (Agility) combat check this turn the Linked quality equal to Force rating during the check.

Talent.Name: Saber Throw
Talent.Description: As an action, make a Lightsaber attack as a ranged attack at a target within medium range. Add [FORCE] up to Force rating. Must spend [FP] and succeed to hit target. Spend [FP] to return weapon to hand.

Talent.Name: Balance
Talent.Description: When the character heals strain at the end of the encounter, he may add [FORCE] per Force rating. He recoveres additional strain equal to [FP] generated.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Hawk Bat Swoop
Talent.Description: As an action, make a Lightsaber (Agility) attack against a target within short range, adding [FORCE] up to Force rating. Spend [FP] to engage target and [FP] to add [ADVANTAGE] to check.

Talent.Name: Terrify
Talent.Description: As an action, make a [DI][DI][DI] Coercion check, adding [FORCE] no greater than Force rating. Disorient 1 target within medium range per [SUCCESS]. Spending [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] extends duration and [FP] immobilizes affected target.

Talent.Name: Terrify (Improved)
Talent.Description: Reduce the difficulty of Terrify's check to [DI][DI] and may spend [TRIUMPH] to stagger an affected target.

Talent.Name: Prey on the Weak
Talent.Description: Add +1 damage to one hit of successful combat checks against disoriented targets per rank of Prey on the Weak.

Talent.Name: Against All Odds
Talent.Description: When incapacitated, perform an Against all Odds action, make [DI][DI][DI] Resilience check with [FORCE] equal to Force rating. Heal wounds equal to [SUCCESS], spend [FP] to add [SUCCESS].

Talent.Name: Intuitive Evasion
Talent.Description: As a maneuver suffer 1 strain and commit [FORCE] up to ranks of Intuitive Evasion. Upgrade difficulty of attacks targeting starship or vehicle by an equal amount. Suffer 1 strain each round [FORCE] stay committed.

Talent.Name: Intuitive Strike
Talent.Description: When making a combat check with a planetary scale weapon, add [FORCE] up to Force rating to the check. Spend [FP][FP] to add [SUCCESS] or [ADVANTAGE].

Talent.Name: Touch of Fate
Talent.Description: Once per session, add [BOOST][BOOST] to any 1 check.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Talent.Name: Exhaust Port
Talent.Description: Before attacking a starship or vehicle, may spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore the effects of the Massive rule for the attack.

Talent.Name: Skilled Teacher
Talent.Description: If an ally at short range has lower ranks in a skill than the chracter, the character may perform a Skilled Teacher incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Skilled Teacher, then add an equal number of [SUCCESS] to that ally's next check for that skill.

Talent.Name: Wise Warrior
Talent.Description: When making a combat check, may perform the Wise Warrior incidental, spend 1 Destiny Point and use any characteristic for the check.

Talent.Name: Wise Warrior (Improved)
Talent.Description: When performing the Wise Warrior incidental, one ally at short range may use the same characteristic for the next combat check the ally makes, before the end of the character's next turn.

Talent.Name: Once A Learner
Talent.Description: As an action, suffer 4 strain and let one ally within short range increase their Force rating by an amount equal to the character's Force rating unti lthe end of the round.

Talent.Name: Now the Master
Talent.Description: Once per session, choose one talent or Force power that any character in the current encounter possesses. Gain that talent or Force power until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Force Protection
Talent.Description: As a maneuver, suffer 1 strain and commit [FO] up to ranks in Force Protection. Increase soak by amount committed until start of next turn. Suffer 1 strain each turn [FO] are committed.

Talent.Name: Center of Being
Talent.Description: Take a Center of Being maneuver. Until the start of next turn, attacks against the character increase their crit rating by 1 per rank of Center of Being.

Talent.Name: Circle of Shelter
Talent.Description: When an engaged ally suffers a hit, may use Parry or Reflect incidental against the hit.

Talent.Name: Tactical Advance
Talent.Description: While in cover, the character may suffer 2 strain to perform the Tactical Advance incidental. Until the end of the character's next turn, the character and allies within short range may move out of cover and continue to receive its benefits.

Talent.Name: Adaptable
Talent.Description: When resolving a check that uses a skill in which they have no ranks, the chracter may spend one Destiny Point to remove [DESPAIR] from the check or to remove [THREAT] equal to thier ranks in Cool from the check.

Talent.Name: Another's Treasure
Talent.Description: The condition of an item does not affect the price the character receives when selling it. In addition, the character can always find a buyer for an item, no matter its condition or how useless or worthless it may seem. The details of the transaction are subject to the CM's discretion, as always, and a buyer might not be immediately (or easily) available.

Talent.Name: Assault Drop
